result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A. Glenn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $1000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with anyone in Kenosha, victims, Jeremiah M or any of the M family, Daavid B-C or his family, any of the other par  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.ties involved in the theft., unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

timeConds.notes:
225 days are stayed.
Credit for 140 days.
Huber allowed.

records.addlTxt: Discharged from probation on 1/22/17
Discharged regular on 1/22/17
Per clarification from Judge Wagner - the restitution is ordered only for 14CF915.  There was no restitution ordered in the sentencing for 14CF917.
Bond applied; partial refund.  jk/cp  ck#15CH073578
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from victim K.F.and S.C.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail, 225 days are stayed, credit for 140 days served; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; $1,000 fine plus costs; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty McGrath acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  Atty McGrath moves to modify bond.  ADA McNeill waives notice of bond motion.  Court amends bond conditions to include that the deft is not to leave the State of WI.  SEH 1/22/15 at 2pm.
8-15-14 Preliminary Hearing

Judge Wilbur W Warren III, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty D Hertz-McGrath appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty McGrath states she filed a request for documents that was served on the State on 11/14/14; deft may be withdrawing the speedy trial demand.  JSH continued to 12/3/14 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
to compel production of discovery and production of all exculpatory evidence in the control of the State and their agents; filed by Atty D Hertz-McGrath.

JSH reset from 11/13/14 at 1:15pm to 11/17/14 at 4pm.  Bond continued.

Judge Chad Kerkman, Acting Br. 6 for today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Berman.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Court grants Atty Berman's motion to withdraw as counsel.  Public Defender to appoint another attorney to represent def.  Status conf. 10/21/14 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Berman, and by approval of the court, the deadline for filing all motions is changed from 10/1/14 to 10/6/14.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty D Berman appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Berman's motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion to modify bond for reasons set forth on the record.  STC 10/6/14 at 1:15pm.
to modify bond; filed by Atty D Berman.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Berman.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  Atty Berman acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  Atty Berman makes speedy trial demand.  JSH 11/13/14 at 1:15pm and JS 12/8/14 at 9am; any motions to be filed by 10/1/14.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. David Berman. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA McNeill. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KPD Officer Matthew Curi sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Berman.  Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 9-9-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.
David Berman
